name: Thomas S. EMERICK v. Joseph DINUBILE, in his own right and as Executor of the Estate of Anna DiNubile and Anna DiNubile, his wife, Appellants

judges: Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
parties: Thomas S. EMERICK v. Joseph DINUBILE, in his own right and as Executor of the Estate of Anna DiNubile and Anna DiNubile, his wife, Appellants.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM.
Decree affirmed. Costs on appellants.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: James E. DelBello, Media, for appellants.
M. Kay Gartrell, Philadelphia, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
344 A.2d 459
Thomas S. EMERICK v. Joseph DINUBILE, in his own right and as Executor of the Estate of Anna DiNubile and Anna DiNubile, his wife, Appellants.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued June 26, 1975.
Decided Oct. 3, 1975.
James E. DelBello, Media, for appellants.
M. Kay Gartrell, Philadelphia, for appellee.
Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
